newsitem.title: UK: Skikda port unaffected by Algiers quake - official.
newsitem.headline: Skikda port unaffected by Algiers quake - official.

text.p: Operations at Algeria's main oil product export port of Skikda were unaffected by an earthquake measuring 5.7 on the Richter scale which injured 13 people on Wednesday, a port official said.
"We felt nothing here in Skikda...Everything is loading normally," he said by telephone.

The quake had its epicentre 60 km west of Algiers, which is about 350 km west of Skikda. There was no immediate indication whether Algeria's other main oil export ports -- Arzew, Bejaia, Algiers and Bedhioua -- were affected.
